newsitem.title: CHINA: China regions get right to okay bigger investment.
newsitem.headline: China regions get right to okay bigger investment.

text.p: China is to allow local authorities in its less-developed regions to approve foreign investment of up to $30 million, compared with a previous limit of $10 million, the Financial News said on Friday.
The move, approved by the State Planning Commission in Beijing, is aimed at attracting greater foreign investment to poorer and more backward interior provinces and regions, the newspaper said.
Approved foreign investment in central and western regions accounts for just 10.9 percent of the national total while actual investment accounts for 11.1 percent, the newspaper said.
